name: Kepler-379
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-379 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-379 is a star with 1.7 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.31 times its radius. It is located 2436.39 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-379 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-379 b

Kepler-379 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.15 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 20.10 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-379.

The mass of Kepler-379 b is 3.24 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-379 b is 1.66 that of Earth. At 3.24 Earth masses, Kepler-379 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.

Kepler-379 c

Kepler-379 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.33 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 62.78 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-379.

The mass of Kepler-379 c is 7.00 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-379 c is 2.29 that of Earth. At 7.00 Earth masses, Kepler-379 c is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-379, which contains 2 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
